item.title: 美联储穆萨莱姆警告通胀预期升温和滞胀风险
item.description: 圣路易斯联储主席阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆强调了美国中央银行可能面临的困难选择。【原文：St. Louis Fed President Alberto Musalem highlighted potentially difficult choices facing the U.S. central bank.】

item.title: 雷普索尔公司将绿色氢气目标削减多达 63
item.description: 西班牙能源公司雷普索尔（Repsol）首席执行官约苏-乔恩-伊马兹（Josu Jon Imaz）周四表示，该公司将其 2030 年绿色制氢目标削减了多达 63%，这凸显了严重依赖补贴的高成本行业所面临的挑战。【原文：Spanish energy company Repsol cut its 2030 target for green hydrogen production by up to 63%, Chief Executive Josu Jon Imaz said on Thursday, highlighting the challenges of a high-cost industry heavily reliant on subsidies.】

item.title: 首席执行官：特朗普关税可能促使空客优先考虑非美国客户
item.description: 空中客车公司首席执行官纪尧姆-福瑞（Guillaume Faury）周四在接受CNBC采访时表示，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收的关税扰乱了该公司在美国的进口，那么空中客车公司可能会优先向非美国客户交付产品。【原文：Airbus could prioritise deliveries to non-U.S. customers if tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump were to disrupt the company's imports in the country, CEO Guillaume Faury said in an interview with CNBC on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普提名的人选表示，该机构将采取公平、客观的方法来处理特斯拉安全问题
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统提名的美国交通部第二高官誓言，政府将采取公正客观的方式监督特斯拉汽车安全调查。【原文：President Donald Trump's nominee to serve as the second highest ranking official at the U.S. Transportation Department vowed the government will take a fair and objective approach to overseeing auto safety probes into Tesla .】

item.title: Together AI 最新融资后估值达 33 亿美元
item.description: Together AI 周四表示，在完成 3.05 亿美元的融资后，公司估值达到了 33 亿美元。【原文：Together AI said on Thursday it hit a valuation of $3.3 billion after a $305 million funding round.】

item.title: 特朗普提名的候选人称，美国监管机构 "需要对波音公司更加严厉"。
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统提名的美国交通部副部长说，监管机构需要采取更积极的方法来监督飞机制造商波音公司。【原文：President Donald Trump's nominee to serve as deputy secretary of the U.S. Transportation Department said regulators need to take a more aggressive approach to overseeing planemaker Boeing .】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克预计 2025 年降息两次，但认为不确定性普遍存在
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周四表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易和移民政策的影响仍存在广泛的不确定性，但美国央行今年仍应能够将利率下调半个百分点。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said on Thursday the U.S. central bank should still be able to lower interest rates by a half a percentage point this year, though there remains extensive uncertainty about the impact of President Donald Trump's trade and immigration policies.】

item.title: 塔吉特公司被佛罗里达州起诉在 DEI 问题上欺骗股东
item.description: Target 周四被佛罗里达州起诉，指控其隐瞒多元化和社会活动的风险，导致顾客反弹，股价下跌。【原文：Target was sued on Thursday by the state of Florida for allegedly concealing the risks of its diversity and social initiatives, leading to a backlash among customers that caused its stock price to decline.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税后，巴西钢铁制造商格道重新考虑墨西哥工厂
item.description: 巴西钢铁制造商 Gerdau 公司首席执行官周四表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普实施的关税措施动摇了全球贸易，该公司可能会选择提高在美国的产能，而不是在墨西哥新建一座工厂。【原文：Brazilian steelmaker Gerdau may opt to bump up its output capacity in the United States instead of building a new plant in Mexico, its CEO said on Thursday, as tariffs implemented by President Donald Trump shake up global trade.】

item.title: OpenAI 的每周活跃用户数突破 4 亿
item.description: ChatGPT开发商OpenAI的一位发言人周四告诉路透社记者，该公司的周活跃用户在2月份突破了4亿，突显了人工智能工具应用的快速增长。【原文：ChatGPT developer OpenAI's weekly active users surged past 400 million in February, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Thursday, highlighting rapid growth in the adoption of artificial intelligence tools.】

item.title: 欧盟贸易负责人看到美国降低关税的意愿，希望避免痛苦
item.description: 欧盟贸易委员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周四表示，他与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府进行贸易谈判的首要任务是避免美国单方面征收关税和欧盟采取反制措施给双方带来经济痛苦。【原文：European Union trade commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Thursday that his top priority in trade talks with President Donald Trump's administration is to avoid a period of economic pain for both sides from unilateral U.S. tariffs and EU countermeasures.】

item.title: 苏黎世保险营业利润略高于预期，评估加州野火影响
item.description: 苏黎世保险公司周四公布的年度营业利润略高于预期，原因是保险公司正在经受气候灾害和战争的影响。【原文：Zurich Insurance reported slightly higher-than-expected annual operating profit on Thursday, as insurers ride out the impact of climate disasters and wars.】

item.title: 价格投入激增，美国大西洋中部工厂发展势头放缓
item.description: 由于投入品价格飙升，2 月份美国大西洋中部地区的工厂产出增长放缓，衡量生产材料支付价格的指标甚至在唐纳德-特朗普总统对进口商品征收的大部分新关税即将生效之前就已攀升至近两年半以来的最高点。【原文：Factory output growth slowed in the U.S. mid-Atlantic region in February as input prices surged, with a measure of prices paid for production materials climbing to the highest in nearly two-and-a-half years even before most of the new tariffs on imports imposed by President Donald Trump are due to take effect.】

item.title: 可口可乐希望在冠军杯营销竞赛中击败百事可乐
item.description: 可口可乐公司正试图利用巴基斯坦举办近 30 年来最盛大板球赛事的机会，通过挖掘该国对 "带球板球 "的热爱，抢走主办国官方球队赞助商百事可乐的风头。【原文：Coca-Cola is attempting to capitalise on Pakistan hosting its biggest cricket event in nearly 30 years, and steal the spotlight away from the host nation's official team sponsor Pepsi, by tapping into the country's love of 'tape-ball cricket'.】

item.title: Stellantis 推出首个内部自动驾驶技术
item.description: Stellantis 于本周四宣布推出其首个自主研发的自动驾驶系统 STLA AutoDrive，该系统旨在让城市通勤者能够暂时从事非驾驶任务。【原文：Stellantis announced on Thursday the launch of its first in-house-developed automated driving system, STLA AutoDrive, designed to allow urban commuters to momentarily engage in non-driving tasks.】

item.title: 亚马逊米高梅影业将获得 "007 "系列电影的创意控制权
item.description: 科技巨头亚马逊米高梅影业公司（Amazon MGM Studios）周四表示，该公司将与长期版权持有者迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）和芭芭拉-布洛柯里（Barbara Broccoli）成立一家新的合资公司，负责詹姆斯-邦德（James Bond）系列电影的创意控制。【原文：Amazon MGM Studios will take creative control of the James Bond franchise under a new joint venture with longtime rights holders Michael Wilson and Barbara Broccoli, the tech giant said on Thursday.】

item.title: 雷普索尔公司称特朗普的天然气政策将有助于降低价格
item.description: 西班牙石油公司雷普索尔（Repsol）首席执行官周四表示，他预计美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的能源政策将对天然气行业产生积极影响，包括增加产量和降低价格。【原文：The chief executive of Spanish oil company Repsol said on Thursday he expected U.S. President Donald Trump's energy policies would have a positive impact on the gas industry including increased output and lower prices.】

item.title: 波音公司首席执行官称马斯克在 "空军一号 "飞机的时间安排上提供了帮助
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）周四表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提出抱怨后，波音公司正在得到特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的帮助，以通过拖延已久的 "空军一号 "项目的要求。【原文：Boeing is getting help from Tesla CEO Elon Musk to get through the requirements of the long-delayed Air Force One program, following complaints from U.S. President Donald Trump, the planemaker's CEO Kelly Ortberg said on Thursday.】

item.title: 报告称美国 2 月新车销量将增长 8.1%
item.description: 行业咨询公司J.D. Power和GlobalData周四在一份联合报告中称，经调整后，2月份美国新车零售销量预计将增长8.1%，达到101万辆。【原文：U.S. new vehicle retail sales are expected to rise 8.1% to 1.01 million units in February on an adjusted basis, industry consultants J.D. Power and GlobalData said in a joint report on Thursday.】

item.title: Netflix 未来 4 年将在墨西哥投资 10 亿美元
item.description: 流媒体巨头 Netflix 首席执行官周四宣布投资 10 亿美元，在未来四年内在墨西哥制作电影和电视剧。【原文：The chief executive of streaming giant Netflix on Thursday announced a $1 billion investment to produce films and TV series in Mexico over the next four years.】

item.title: 微软新芯片引发技术争论，量子计算类股上涨
item.description: 量子计算股票在周四的盘前交易中上涨，此前微软推出了一款新芯片，表明该技术并非如人工智能芯片风向标英伟达（Nvidia）的高层所说的 "几十年后才会出现"。【原文：Quantum computing stocks rose in premarket trading on Thursday after Microsoft launched a new chip that indicated the technology is not "decades away" as stated by the top boss of AI chip bellwether Nvidia.】

item.title: 瑞士1月份对美黄金出口创13年来新高
item.description: 瑞士海关周四的数据显示，1月份瑞士黄金出口同比增长，原因是对美国的供应量飙升至至少13年来的最高水平，抵消了对主要消费国中国和印度的出口量下降的影响。【原文：Gold exports from Switzerland rose year on year in January as supplies to the United States soared to the highest in at least 13 years and offset lower deliveries to top consumers China and India, Swiss customs data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数略有上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量略有增加，表明劳动力市场的基础依然稳固。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased moderately last week, suggesting that the labor market remained on solid ground.】

item.title: 沃尔玛支持的 PhonePe 准备在印度股市首次亮相
item.description: 沃尔玛支持的印度金融科技公司 PhonePe 周四表示，该公司正开始为在印度证券交易所公开上市做准备。【原文：Walmart -backed Indian fintech firm PhonePe is beginning preparatory steps for a public listing on the country's stock exchanges, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: CenterPoint 与同行一起提高资本支出计划，以满足数据中心的电力需求
item.description: CenterPoint Energy 公司周四将其资本支出计划提高了 5 亿美元，以加强电网建设，应对全国各地新建数据中心激增的电力需求。【原文：CenterPoint Energy on Thursday increased its capital expenditure plan by $500 million to strengthen its electricity grid to handle the surging demand for power from new data centers coming up across the country.】

item.title: 富达为财富经理推出两款全 ETF 模型投资组合
item.description: 富达投资公司（Fidelity Investments）周四表示，该公司已推出两款全 ETF 模型投资组合，供财富管理公司在构建客户投资组合时从快速增长的基金阵营中寻找帮助。【原文：Fidelity Investments said on Thursday that it has launched two all-ETF model portfolios for use by wealth management firms looking for help winnowing through the rapidly growing array of funds to construct client portfolios.】

item.title: 巴西 Natura &Co 公司与 IG4 公司就潜在的雅芳交易进行谈判
item.description: 巴西化妆品制造商 Natura &Co 周四表示，该公司正在与资产管理公司 IG4 就可能出售雅芳在拉丁美洲以外地区的业务进行独家谈判，但指出谈判仍处于早期阶段。【原文：Brazilian cosmetics maker Natura &Co said on Thursday that it is in exclusive talks with asset manager IG4 for the potential sale of Avon's operations outside Latin America, but noted the negotiations were still at an early stage.】

item.title: 基础设施需求强劲，广达第四季度利润超出预期
item.description: 能源承包商广达服务公司（Quanta Services）周四第四季度利润超出预期，原因是其电力和基础设施相关服务的需求增加，股价在收盘前上涨了 7%。【原文：Energy contractor Quanta Services beat fourth-quarter profit estimates on Thursday, on higher demand for its services related to power and infrastructure, sending shares up 7% before the bell.】

item.title: 马来西亚称东盟计划召开美国峰会讨论关税问题
item.description: 马来西亚外交部长周四表示，东南亚集团东盟计划与美国举行一次峰会，以便其成员国就美国计划征收的关税发表意见。【原文：The Southeast Asian bloc ASEAN plans to hold a summit with the United States so its member countries can present their views on planned U.S. tariffs, Malaysia's Foreign Minister said on Thursday.】

item.title: 沃尔玛预测 2026 财年销售收入低于预期，原因是支出谨慎
item.description: 沃尔玛周四预计，截至2026年1月的财年销售额将低于华尔街目前的预期，这表明这家全球最大的零售商预计，在经历了几个季度的稳健增长后，疲于通胀的消费者将有所回落。【原文：Walmart on Thursday forecast sales for the fiscal year ending January 2026 below Wall Street's current estimates, signaling the world's largest retailer expects inflation-weary consumers to pull back after several quarters of solid growth.】
